rule.title: Blastback
rule.line: You hit the ground with a shuddering boom, propelling the force of your fall out in a wave. You take no damage from the fall as the displaced air allows you to land gently, but all other creatures in the spell's area take 6d4 bludgeoning damage, with a basic Reflex save. Creatures that fail their save are pushed back 5 feet.
rule.heighten: The emanation increases by 10 feet, and the damage increases by 3d4.

rule.title: Blazing Dive
rule.line: Superheated air collects under you, buoying you high into the sky before you plummet back down in a fiery comet. You Fly 15 feet straight up into the air, then Fly in a straight line into an empty space of your choice on the ground within 60 feet.
When you land, the blistering air blasts out from you, dealing 3d4 bludgeoning damage and 3d6 fire damage to all creatures in a 10-foot emanation.
rule.heighten: The damage increases by 1d4 bludgeoning and 1d6 fire.

rule.title: Blindness
rule.line: You blind the target. The effect is determined by the target's Fortitude save. The target then becomes temporarily immune for 1 minute.

line.success: The target is blinded until the end of its next turn.
line.fail: The target is blinded for 1 minute.

rule.title: Cloud Dragon's Cloak
rule.trigger: You or an ally in range is targeted by a ranged attack
rule.targets: the creature targeted by the attack
rule.line: A cloud of mist enshrouds the target, appearing much like the deflecting clouds created by cloud dragons. The target is treated as hidden for the purposes of resolving the triggering attack (so normally the attacker must succeed at a DC 11 flat check to target it) and all ranged attacks against it for the duration.

rule.title: Coral Scourge
rule.line: Barnacles, coral, and other rough aquatic creatures grow on the target's body, getting between their joints and stiffening their movement. This impedes the target's movement depending on the resutl of its saving throw.

line.fail: The target is clumsy 2. Each round at the beginning of its turn, the target increases its clumsy condition by 1, to a maximum of clumsy 4. If the target's clumsy condition from this spell reaches 4, the growths spread to cover the target's entire body, and the target becomes paralyzed.
The target can Interact to scrape the coral growth from its body, decreasing the clumsy condition to 0 and ending the spell.
line.critfail: As failure, but when the target Interacts to scrape the coral growths from its body, it reduces the clumsy condition by 1 instead of decreasing it to 0, and decreasing the clumsy condition to 0 doesn't end the spell.

rule.title: Crashing Wave
rule.line: You summon a crashing wave that sweeps away from you. You deal 6d6 bludgeoning damage to creatures in the area, with a basic Reflex save. The water also extinguishes non-magical fires in the area.

rule.title: Croak Voice
rule.line: You cause the target creature's vocal chords to swell like those of a frog. The target must attempt a Fortitude save.

line.success: The target's voice becomes hoarse, and speaking becomes painful. Whenever it uses an action that has the auditory trait or attempts to Cast a Spell that doesn't have the subtle trait, it must succeed at a DC 5 flat check or the action is lost.
Once per round, the target can spend an Interact action to massage its throat, attempting to a Fortitude save against your spell DC. On a success, the spell ends.
line.fail: As success, but using an action with the auditory trait also deals 2d10 mental damage to the target as the sound of its distorted voice grates on its ears.
line.critfail: As failure, but the damage for using an action with the auditory trait is doubled, and the target can't use an Interact action to attempt a Fortitude save to end the effect early.

rule.heighten: The damage for using an action with the auditory trait increases by 1d10.

rule.title: Dive and Breach
rule.line: You make the briefest of dives through the Plane of Water. You Leap 10 feet, and where you land on the ground, you instead disappear in a splash of water, your body entering the surface like a diver entering a pool. You then exit from an unoccupied surface within 40 feet, appearing in another splash of water as you Leap out, landing 10 feet away from where you exited.
Each splash deals 3d10 bludgeoning damage to all creatures in a 5-foot emantion, with a basic Reflex save; creatures in multiple splash zones take damage once.
rule.heighten: The damage dealt by each splash increass by 1d10.

rule.title: Earthbind
rule.line: Using the weight of the earth, you hamper a target's flight, with effects based on its Fortitude save. If the creature reaches the ground safely, it doesn't take falling damage.

line.success: The target falls safely up to 120 feet.
line.fail: The target falls safely up to 120 feet. If it hits the ground, it can't Fly, levitate, or otherwise leave the ground for 1 round.
line.critfail: The target falls safely up to 120 feet. If it hits the ground, it can't Fly, levitate, or otherwise leave the ground for 1 minute.

rule.title: Fireball
rule.line: A roaring blast of fire appears at a spot you designate, dealing 6d6 fire damage, with a basic Reflex save.

rule.title: Haste
rule.line: Magic empowers the target to act faster. It gains the quickened condition and can use the extra action each round only to Strike or Stride.
rule.heighten: You can target up to 6 creatures.

rule.title: Holy Light
rule.line: You shoot a blazing ray of light tinged with holy energy. Make a ranged spell attack against the target's AC. The ray deals 5d6 fire damage. If the target has the unholy trait, you deal an extra 5d6 spirit damage.

If the light passes through an area of magical darkness or targets a creature affected by magical darkness, holy light attempts to counteract the darkness. If you need to determine whether the light passes through an area of darkness, draw a line between yourself and the target.
rule.heighten: The fire damage increases by 2d6, and the spirit damage against unholy creatures increases by 2d6.

rule.title: Lightning Bolt
rule.line: A bolt of lightning strikes outward from your hand, dealing 4d12 electricity damage, with a basic Reflex save.

rule.title: Lotus Walk
rule.line: Lotuses, water lilies, and other watery plants bloom at your feet, allowing you to walk on the surface of water and other liquids. You can go underwater if you wish, but in that case you must Swim normally. As you Stride or Step on water, you leave a trail of oversized lily pads, lotus leaves, or spatterdock that fill the squares' surfaces in your wake. Each square of this trail can withstand the weight of 1 Medium creature and lasts until the end of your next turn. You can Dismiss the spell early.
rule.heighten: The duration of this spell increases to 10 minutes. The trail lasts until the spell ends or you Dismiss the spell on you, whichever comes first.

The duration increases to 1 hour. Your trail is permanent even if you Dismiss the spell on you, although if the water can't support such plants, they'll die in a week. The trail can be removed by dispel magic or a similar spell.

rule.title: Magnetic Acceleration
rule.line: You magnetize a small metal object, such as a nail or coin, and launch it away from you at massive speed. Make a ranged spell attack roll against the target; if the target is wearing metal armor or is made of metal, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your attack roll. On a hit, the target takes 3d6 bludgeoning damage and 3d6 piercing damage, or double damage on a critical hit.
rule.heighten: The bludgeoning and piercing damage each increase by 1d6.

rule.title: Moth's Supper
rule.line: You sigh, and your breath transforms into delicate, black-winged butterflies and huge death's-head hawkmoths. They flutter about you briefly, and then range forth in search of sustenance -fresh-spilled blood, by preference, but rotting corpses, flowering plants, or even left-behind food will do in a pinch. They then return, perching on your hair or shoulders and whispering their secrets into your ears. This has three effects:

line.entry: You heal 2d4 Hit Points every 10 minutes.
The first time during the duration when someone successfully Treats your Wounds, you regain an additional 4d4 Hit Points.
You gain an imprecise sense out to 30 feet that senses only freshly spilled blood and rotten flesh.

rule.heighten: The amount of Hit Points healed every 10 minutes increases by 1d4 and the amount of Hit Points regained from the first Treat Wounds increases by 2d4.

rule.title: Organsight
rule.targets: 1 living creature or undead creature that has organs
rule.line: You see the target as though it's dissected and arrayed before you. For the duration, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus on Medicine checks against the target when they depend on its organs, but a -2 circumstance penalty when they depend on seeing its skin.

When you Cast the Spell, attempt a special Recall Knowledge check using Medicine to discern a vital organ the target has. If you have a Lore skill appropriate for the creature, you can use that skill instead of Medicine. If you succeed, the next time you deal piercing or slashing damage ot the target with a Strike or spell, you deal 4d6 additional precision damage. On each of your subsequent turns, you can use a single action to attempt this special Recall Knowledge check again. The extra damage isn't cumulative, so making the check more than once before a Strike or spell has no extra benefit.

rule.title: Slow
rule.line: You dilate the flow of time around the target, slowing its actions based on its Fortitude save result:

line.success: The target is slowed 1 for 1 round.
line.fail: The target is slowed 1 for 1 minute.
line.critfail: The target is slowed 2 for 1 minute.

rule.heighten: You can target up to 10 creatures.

rule.title: Soothing Blossoms
rule.line: Blossoms grow from the ground in a small area, soothing away afflictions and persistent pains and harm. When any creature in the area rolls a successful save against a poison or disease effect, it gets a critical success instead.

The blossoms also grant assisted recovery to everyone in the area to end their persistent damage, both when the spell is cast and at the start of each of your turns; this reduces the DC for the next flat check an assisted creature makes against the persistent damage to 10.

Once the duration ends, the flowers lose their magical effect, but a few of them might survive in the area as long as they can naturally. This spell doesn't give a benefit on a save against affliction unless the stage lasts 10 minutes or less.

rule.title: Stinking Cloud
rule.line: You create a cloud of putrid mists. All creatures in the cloud become concealed, and all creatures outside the cloud are concealed to creatures within it. A creature that ends its turn in the cloud must make a Fortitude save.

line.fail: The creature is sickened 1, and is slowed 1 while in the cloud.
line.critfail: The creature is sickened 2, and is slowed 1 while in the cloud.

rule.line: The concealed condition is not a poison effect. You can Dismiss the cloud.

rule.title: Tempest Cloak
rule.line: You shroud one creature in a cloak of fierce, howling winds, shielding it from attacks and making it difficult to approach. The twisting shield of wind creates difficult terrain in 1 5-foot burst surrounding the target. The target also gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against physical ranged attacks, such as attacks made with a bow, javelin, or sling.
In addition, the swirling storms makes it easier for the target to ignore anything it doesn't want to hear, granting the target a +2 circumstance bonus to all defenses against auditory effects.

rule.title: Wall of Thorns
rule.line: Over the course of a minute, a thick wall of thorny brambles grows from the ground. You create a 5-foot-thick wall of brambles and thorns in a straight line up to 60 feet long and 10 feet high. You must create the wall in an unbroken open space so its edges don't pass through any creatures or objects, or the spell is lost. The wall stands vertically.

If you wish, the wall can be of a shorter length or height. Everything on each side of the wall has cover from creatures on the opposite side, and the wall's spaces are difficult terrain. For every move action a creature uses to enter at least one of the wall's spaces, that creature takes 3d4 piercing damage.
Each 10-foot-by-10-foot section of the wall has AC 10, Hardness 10, and 20 Hit Points. It's immune to critical hits and precision damage. A destroyed section can be moved through freely.
rule.heighten: The Hit Points of each section of the wall increase by 5, and the piercing damage increases by 1d4.

rule.title: Wooden Double
rule.trigger: You're critically hit by a damage-dealing effect or Strike
rule.line: A wooden double appears out of nowhere and takes a blow in your place. Take a Step action. A wooden block of your size and roughly shaped like you appears in the space you left and absorbs the hit.

This block has Hardness 5 and 20 Hit Points. If the wooden block is destroyed, you take any excess damage that the block didn't absorb. After taking the blow, the wooden block collapses into a pile of splinters and dust.
rule.heighten: The block's Hit Points increase by 10.
